entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: South to southwest winds may approach severe gale. Note, expect large waves about exposed coasts. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.summary: Southerly winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, with thunderstorms and downpours possible. Rainfall amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Thunderstorms and downpours possible until Wednesday evening. Note, northerly rain through to Wednesday evening, followed by southerly rain Wednesday night into the early hours of Thursday. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate. Changes: Watch period extended to 3am on Thursday.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Heavy rain has eased for a time this morning, however another period of heavy rain is expected from late this morning until tonight. Expect another 60 to 90 mm of rain, with highest accumulations expected east of Opotiki. Peak intensities 15 to 25 mm/h, but possibly 25 to 40 mm/h in localised areas. Thunderstorms and downpours possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain with thunderstorms and localised downpours possible. Amounts may approach warning criteria, and possibly exceed them in downpours. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: The risk of broadscale heavy rain reaching warning thresholds has decreased, however thunderstorms are expected this afternoon and evening and there remains a risk of localised warning amounts of heavy rain, especially about eastern Waikato and eastern Taupo where severe thunderstorms and downpours are likely. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Low. Changes: Start time of Watch now midday.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary: Unstable showery conditions spread southwards onto the central North Island late this morning and afternoon, with a moderate risk of thunderstorms. Some of these thunderstorms may become SEVERE this afternoon across Coromandel Peninsula, eastern parts of Waikato and Taupo, and Bay of Plenty, with localised downpours of 25 to 40 mm/h, large hail in excess of 20 mm diameter, strong wind gusts of 90 km/h, and a slight chance of a damaging tornado. Expect thunderstorm activity to ease by evening.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary: Unstable showery conditions spread southwards onto the upper North Island today, with a moderate risk of thunderstorms over Northland and Auckland. Some of these thunderstorms may become SEVERE across eastern parts of Northland this morning and early afternoon, then Auckland around midday and through the afternoon, with localised downpours of 25 to 40 mm/h, large hail in excess of 20 mm diameter, strong wind gusts of 90 km/h, and a slight chance of a damaging tornado. Expect thunderstorm activity to ease by evening.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning
entry.summary:
At 04:22 pm, MetService weather radar detected severe thunderstorms near RAWENE, MANGAMUKA, KOHUKOHU, BROADWOOD and THE MAUNGATANIWHA RANGE.
These severe thunderstorms are moving towards the east, and are expected to lie near KAIKOHE, KERIKERI, OKAIHAU and NGAWHA SPRINGS at 04:52 pm and near KAWAKAWA, PAIHIA, TOWAI, RUSSELL, BAY OF ISLANDS, WHANGARURU, OPUA, PUHIPUHI and WAIHAHA at 05:22 pm.
These thunderstorms are expected to be accompanied by very heavy rain.
Impact:
Very heavy rain can cause surface and/or flash flooding about streams, gullies and urban areas, and make driving conditions extremely hazardous.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning
entry.summary:
At 04:22 pm, MetService weather radar detected severe thunderstorms near MOENGAWAHINE, TITOKI, PURUA and HEN AND CHICKEN ISLANDS.
These severe thunderstorms are moving towards the eastsoutheast, and are expected to lie near WHANGAREI, RUAKAKA, MARSDEN POINT and PORTLAND at 04:52 pm and near HEN AND CHICKEN ISLANDS at 05:22 pm.
These thunderstorms are expected to be accompanied by very heavy rain.
Impact:
Very heavy rain can cause surface and/or flash flooding about streams, gullies and urban areas, and make driving conditions extremely hazardous.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
